#Text=Turkey , US embassies resume issuing non-immigrant visas
#Text=Thursday , November 9 , 2017

#Text=On Monday , the US embassy in Turkey ' s capital Ankara released a statement on their website announcing they are to resume accepting new requests for non-immigrant visas on a limited basis in the country .
#Text=Shortly after the announcement , the Turkish embassy in the US capital Washington DC also announced they are to continue processing a limited number of non-immigrant visas .

#Text=Last month , after a Turkish employee at the US embassy was arrested , the embassy introduced this measure to minimise how many visitors they received while they " assess[ed ] the commitment of the Government of Turkey to the security of our diplomatic facilities and personnel . "

#Text=Turkey 's embassy , in their statement , said  Turkey also has very serious concerns about ongoing cases against Turkish citizens in the U.S. " ( ( tr))Turkish language : ‍ABD'de

column1: #Text=Türk vatandaşlarıyla ilgili süren davalara ilişkin de türkiye'nin çok ciddi endişeleri bulunmaktadır and said none of the Turkish employees working for the US embassy were under investigation for their service .
#Text=However , the detained employees of the US embassy had " very serious charges " and has pending cases , Turkey said .
#Text=Turkish officials arrested two staff members this year .
#Text=Metin Topuz , a Turkish employee at the embassy , was arrested on October 4 for alleged ties with Fethullah Gülen .
#Text=Gülen is currently in the US , in exile from Turkey .
#Text=According to the Turkish government , Gülen played a major role in last year 's failed coup which led to the deaths of more than 250 people .
#Text=Last month , Ankara 's US embassy ambassador John Bass said , " We have been unable to determine why it occurred or what , if any , evidence exists against the employee .

#Text=Uluçay was a translator in the US consulate in Adana , and was accused of belonging to the Kurdistan Worker 's Party , which the Turkish government has labelled a  terror organisation " .

column1: #Text=John Bass explained the ban was not to prevent Turkish citizens from entering the US .
#Text=Turkish citizens who already have a US visa could visit the country .
#Text=And they could apply for visas from embassies outside Turkey , Bass clarified in the statement .

#Text=In regards to the latest assurance from the Turkish government , the US embassy said " the security posture has improved sufficiently to allow for the resumption of limited visa services in Turkey .
